column4: can someone assist me in troubleshooting my sound card conflict?
run lspci on terminal
see if youre sound card is detected
pastebin the output plz
it says NVidia and VT82xx
run alsamixer on terminal, make sure Master is on 100 not muted
the problem is the NVidia is being detected as the primary sound card. It has no details on amixer. I cant make seem to change the default sound to the built-in sound card.
which is youre main sound card, the one built in with the computer ?
try sudo apt-get install linux-backports-modules-alsa-karmic-generic and reboot
I was using the built-in audio before and was working properly. then I installed a new GPU, the GPU is being detected also as a sound device and it becomes the default based on alsamixer
you can try change youre default sound card by editing the asound.conf:  sudo gedit /etc/asound.conf
weird, theres no asound.conf on /etc. BTW, im using karmic
oh okay, In terminal now type sudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base
Find the place where it says something like # Prevent abnormal drivers from grabbing index 0 and in the list below add: options snd_whateveryourcardnameswere index=-2
let me know if that fix youre problem
: both are using snd-hda-intel for the driver.
: this is where I hit a brick wall.
open the alsa-base.conf, by useing terminal sudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf
ook for the line “# Prevent abnormal drivers from grabbing index 0″, then above it you want to put the following.. options snd_hda_intel index=1
his will force the other card to become index 0 and hence the default, and reboot youre system
